tutorial.title: Digital Business Card - Part 1
tutorial.descriptionContent: Time to make networking a breeze! In this section, we'll embark on designing your very own digital business card.

executableContent.instructions:
Welcome to the **Digital Business Card** project. Together, we'll create your very own simple yet beautiful contact page. 

1. Write the basic structure of the HTML page, including `DOCTYPE`, `<html>`, `<head>`, and `<body>`.

Let's add some basic content to the page.

1. Add a `title` tag and a suiting title like `Jane Doe Business Card`. Feel free to use your own name.
2. Link to our CSS file with `<link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css">`.

files.name: index.html
files.solvedContent:
<!doctype html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>Jane Doe Business Card</title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css">
  </head>
  <body>
  </body>
</html>

executableContent.instructions:
Let's add some content. We'll start with three empty `divs`.

1. Within the `body`, create a `div` with the class `card`. This will contain all our card details.
2. Inside the card, create two `div` elements.
3. Assign the class `"info"` to the first item and the class `"portrait"` to the second item.

executableContent.instructions:
It's time to add the information that you want to add to the card.

1. Inside the info section, add an `h1` tag with your name.
2. Below the `h1` tag, add an `h2` tag with your description. What about "Aspiring Web Developer"?.
3. Add a `p` tag with a short description of yourself.
4. Add additional info containing your email, phone number, etc., if you want to share it.
5. Finally, add an image inside the portrait section. (If you want to use a stock image, feel free to use `https://mimo.app/i/lori.png`.)

executableContent.instructions:
It's time to transform the boring-looking HTML into a beautiful business card.

1. Start by creating a rule for both the `body` and `html` elements.
2. Set the `height` to `100%`.
3. Set a calming background color to the page. What about `gainsboro` or `lightgray`?
4. Let's use flexbox and center the content vertically and horizontally.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Let's style our business card container `card`.

1. Start by creating a rule for the `card` class.
2. Set a clean background color to make the card distinct. Maybe `white`?
3. Add some padding to the left of the card.
4. Round the corners to give it a modern feel.
5. Set the `width` to `80%`. And set `min-width` and `max-width` to `300px` and `600px`, respectively.
6. Use the CSS grid to layout the card's content.
7. Ensure that the left part of the card uses ⅔ of the space and the right one ⅓. Do this by using `grid-template-columns: 2fr 1fr;`.
8. Set `overflow: hidden;` to have the image not pop over the rounded corners.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
Almost there. A few more minor adjustments, and we'll have a beautiful business card.

1. Create a rule for both the `h1` and `h2` elements.
2. Set the `margin` for `h1` and `h2` to `0`.
3. Create a rule for the `portrait` class.
4. Set `margin` and `padding` for `.portrait` to `0`.
5. Finally, create a rule for the `img` element.
6. Set the image's `width` and `height` to `100%`.
7. Add `object-fit: cover;` to the image rule to make the image look nicer.
